column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Numbers were up for a total yarding of 498 mainly good quality cattle. Cows again dominated the yarding with heavy slaughter cows easing 5c while store cows were in demand gaining 10c/kg. Heavy bulls gained as well while a quality yarding of yearlings and grown cattle suitable for processors and feeder buyers gained 5 to 20c/kg.

Yearling steers sold from 306c to 332c while yearling heifers made 256c to 302c/kg.

Bullocks weighing over 500kg sold for 228c to 296c while grown steers weighing under 500kg made 270c to 308c /kg.

Grown heifers weighing under 540kg sold from 250c to 304c while heavier weights made from 240c to 250c/kg.  

Heavy weight cows sold from 180c to 234c, medium weights made 200c to 214c and store cows returned 50c for plain types and up to 220c for the better-quality lines. Heavy bulls sold from 180c to 248c while medium weights returned 220c to 230c/kg.

Tracey Kilner--NLRS
